Description: Lapis lazuli amuletic figure in the form a vulture, more probably than a hawk, stanfing on a rectangular base, with a suspension ring projecting on the back.
Curator's comments: Possibly the lapis lazuli "hawk" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.62, p.180, pl.22)
